issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: NPE in DataNode#getDiskBalancerStatus() when the DN is restarted

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

2018-06-28 05:12:08,400 ERROR org.apache.hadoop.jmx.JMXJsonServlet: getting attribute DiskBalancerStatus of Hadoop:service=DataNode,name=DataNodeInfo threw an exception
javax.management.RuntimeMBeanException: java.lang.NullPointerException
{noformat}

We have seen the above exception at datanode startup time. Should improve the NPE. Changing it to an IOE will also allow jmx to return '' correctly for \{{getDiskBalancerStatus}}

.
fields.summary: NPE in DataNode due to uninitialized DiskBalancer

Thanks for the review Inigo, I agree adding unit test for the fix is common best practice. Also agree ideally one should simulate the exact scenario that caused the failure, to make sure the fix actually fixed it.

For this Jira though, it seems straightforward that when {{diskBalancer}} object is not initialized (or if after {{shutdownDiskBalancer}} is called), any calls to the methods which depend on it would run into NPE. We can add a unit test to construct a {{DataNode}} object, and call {{DataNode#getDiskBalancerStatus}} which would NPE-before, pass-after. But I don't feel it has much value, similar to we don't test that {{diskBalancer}} is not null after {{initDiskBalancer}} or is null after {{shutdownDiskBalancer}} currently. :)

So I propose not to add a unit test. What do you think? Let me know if you feel strongly about adding a unit test.

If we can add it to one of the existing unit tests, that'd be ideal.
Otherwise, let's go with this.
The failed unit tests are unrelated.
Thanks Inigo, good idea to sliding this into existing tests. Done in patch 2.

Thanks [~xiaochen], for working on this. patch v1 looks good to me. +1.

Thanks [~xiaochen] for the patch.
The unit test failures seem unrelated and the ones tweaked look good [here|https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/24565/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.diskbalancer/TestDiskBalancer/].
+1 on  [^HDFS-13721.02.patch].
Failed tests look unrelated and passed locally. Committing this.
Committed to trunk. Thanks for the review [~elgoiri] and [~shashikant]!

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14534 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14534/])
HDFS-13721. NPE in DataNode due to uninitialized DiskBalancer. (xiao: rev 936e0df0d344f13eea97fe624b154e8356cdea7c)
* (edit) hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/server/diskbalancer/TestDiskBalancer.java
* (edit) hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/server/datanode/DataNode.java
+1, Sorry for the late in comments, thanks for catching and fixing this issue.
I would like to backport this to 3.1 and 3.0 branch if that is ok. Please let me know if you have any concerns otherwise I will backport this.

I think we should backport this to 3.1 and 3.0 branch. One more issue is reported for the same(HDFS-13809).
[~anu] , are you planning to backport?
[~surendrasingh] Yes, I was planning to do it. I will backport to 3.0 and 3.1 branches. Thanks
There was a minor merge conflict while cherry-picking to branch-3.0, I don't have time to look into it right now so I didn't backport to 3.0 for the time being.
